## GAD-7 vs YABCL

When conducting societal and psychological studies, psychologists often find themselves in front of complex questions like comparing instruments like GAD-7 and YABCL. Harmony offers a solution to such complex scenarios by providing interactive analytical tools for a comprehensive comparison of different psychological instruments. With Harmony, analyzing the items of GAD-7 vs YABCL, two fundamental psychological assessment tools, has become significantly more reliable and efficient than ever before. Harmony employs advanced Natural Language Processing (NLP) and generative AI models, which help to harmonize questionnaire items and perform comparisons across various languages and forms. The use of Harmony for GAD-7 vs YABCL helps in mapping out individual items between the two instruments, providing a percentage match for each and providing insights for potential overlap or common characteristics. This comparison could potentially identify the strengths and weaknesses of each tool against the other across numerous studies and samples. In conclusion, utilizing Harmony for such comparative analytical purposes can save researchers valuable time and resources, while increasing the accuracy and consistency of results. The capability of Harmony in the comparison like GAD-7 vs YABCL not only innovates the harmonisation process but also opens up new gateways for psychology and social sciences research. Therefore, psychologists everywhere are encouraged to harness the power of Harmony to enhance their research projects.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
